summary: Adds a lore-friendly, standalone set of heavy/light armour, which looks like the one in game trailer, but with powerful enchantments and nearly daedric/dragonscale armor rating. Great for late game players, and roleplaying.
descriptionHtml:
A add-on to this mod Dovahkiin Sword has been released!
http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/39373/

I wanted too look like the dovahkiin from the game trailer in later game, but then i realized that the studded armor is a light one, and iron boots, gauntlets and helmet are very weak. So i did this set :)
It looks exactly like the one from the trailer (iron boots, gauntlets and helmet, iron banded shield and studded armor) ,but EVERY part of it is heavy (there is optional everything light version, you can use both at one time) and has great enchantments. It has nearly daedric armor rating (light one has nearly dragonscale) so it\'s great for later game. And looks awesome. If you have any retextures of those parts of armor it will apply to this mod.
To obtain it, you must have \"Dragon Armor\" smithing perk, and craft it under the Dragon section in SKYFORGE!

Heavy Armor Stats:

Boots: Basic Armor 17 points
Enchantment: Resist frost increased by 70 percent

Cuirass: Basic Armor 48 points
Enchantment: Healing rate increased by 50 percent

Gauntlets: Basic Armor 17 points
Enchantment: One handed weapon make 40 percent more damage

Helmet: Basic Armor 22 points
Enchantment: Time between shouts decreased by 20%

Shield: Basic Armor 34 points
Enchantment: Resist fire increased by 70 %



Light version stats:

Boots: Basic Armor 11 points
Enchantment: Resist frost increased by 70 percent

Cuirass: Basic Armor 39 points
Enchantment: Healing rate increased by 50 percent

Gauntlets: Basic Armor 11 points
Enchantment: One handed weapon make 40 percent more damage

Helmet: Basic Armor 16 points
Enchantment: Time between shouts decreased by 20%

Shield: Basic Armor 28 points
Enchantment: Resist fire increased by 70 %

The textures in the screenshots are not included. Use aMidianBorn\'s Book of Silence texture replacer, found here! 
http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/24909


It is my first mod so leave a comment and tell me what you like and what you don\'t, i might upgrade it for you. :)
And sorry for my poor English ^-^
author: WikGru
